chapters.title: Chapter 30: What the Oath Rod Can Do
chapters.info: Doral Barran, p. 654 (791)—Wisdom of Emond's Field years ago. When an epidemic of the spotted fever struck the city, she advocated holding brandy-soaked handkerchiefs over one's face to ward off the disease. Because of this, Egwene associated the smell of brandy with fear for a very long time.
